fields.name: retrieveStripeAccount
fields.description: Gets information about a user's own stripe connected account

fields.name: retrieveExternalAccount
fields.description: Gets information about a given external account

fields.name: listExternalAccounts
fields.description:
Lists external accounts of a connected user
 limit: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.
 ending_before: https://stripe.com/docs/api/external_account_bank_accounts/list?lang=node#account_list_bank_accounts-ending_before
 starting_after: https://stripe.com/docs/api/external_account_bank_accounts/list?lang=node#account_list_bank_accounts-starting_after

fields.name: retrieveBalance
fields.description: Returns this user's stripe account balance

fields.name: retrieveStripeCustomer
fields.description: Retrieves a customer account

fields.name: listPaymentMethods
fields.description: Lists paymentMethods

fields.name: allMessage
fields.description: Scan through all values of type 'Message'. Use the 'after' and 'before' arguments with the 'nextToken' returned by the 'MessageConnection' result to fetch pages.

fields.name: allMessageConnection
fields.description: Scan through all values of type 'MessageConnection'. Use the 'after' and 'before' arguments with the 'nextToken' returned by the 'MessageConnectionConnection' result to fetch pages.

fields.name: allUser
fields.description: Scan through all values of type 'User'. Use the 'after' and 'before' arguments with the 'nextToken' returned by the 'UserConnection' result to fetch pages.

fields.name: me
fields.description: Get information about myself

fields.name: conversationFromDiscovery
fields.description: Given a discovery id, check to see if a user has already started a convo over it or not. The user sending this request is the one inquiring about a discovery, not the author of the discovery.

fields.name: allAssociated
fields.description: Given a conversation id, fetch the associated user conversations

fields.name: discovery
fields.description: Given a discovery id, fetch all of the info related to the discovery

fields.name: getMyDiscoveries
fields.description: Fetch all of my own discoveries

fields.name: getSurroundingDiscoveries
fields.description: Get the discoveries inside a location defined by a bounded box

fields.name: autocomplete
fields.description: Used for the autocomplete functionality when searching discoveries.

fields.name: search
fields.description: Used to get search results for related discoveries when searching (It only returns the id, title, description and tags for now, so induvidual calls must be made to fetch complete information)

fields.name: allSavedDiscoveries
fields.description: Fetch all of my saved discoveries

types.name: AWSJSON
types.description: The `AWSJSON` scalar type provided by AWS AppSync, represents a JSON string that complies with [RFC 8259](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259).  Maps like "**{\\"upvotes\\": 10}**", lists like "**[1,2,3]**", and scalar values like "**\\"AWSJSON example string\\"**", "**1**", and "**true**" are accepted as valid JSON and will automatically be parsed and loaded in the resolver mapping templates as Maps, Lists, or Scalar values rather than as the literal input strings.  Invalid JSON strings like "**{a: 1}**", "**{'a': 1}**" and "**Unquoted string**" will throw GraphQL validation errors.

fields.name: author
fields.description: The author object. Note: `authorId` is only available because we list it in `extraAttributes` in `Conversation.messages`

fields.name: content
fields.description: The message content.

fields.name: conversationId
fields.description: The id of the Conversation this message belongs to. This is the table primary key.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The message timestamp. This is also the table sort key.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Generated id for a message -- read-only

fields.name: isSent
fields.description: Flag denoting if this message has been accepted by the server or not.

fields.name: username
fields.description: A unique identifier for the user. (cognito id)

fields.name: conversations
fields.description: A user's enrolled Conversations. This is an interesting case. This is an interesting pagination case.

fields.name: messages
fields.description: Get a users messages by querying a GSI on the Messages table.

fields.name: registered
fields.description: Is the user registered?

fields.name: about
fields.description: About section of a user

fields.name: profilePic
fields.description: Link to the profile image of the user

fields.name: rating
fields.description: Rating of this user

fields.name: signUpDate
fields.description: Date that a user signed up on, represented in epoch time in milliseconds

fields.name: family_name
fields.description: The last name of a user

fields.name: given_name
fields.description: The first name of a user

fields.name: school
fields.description: School the person attends

fields.name: categories
fields.description: categories

fields.name: hasChosenCategories
fields.description: Determines whether a person has already selected categories for the first time or not.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The Conversation's timestamp.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the Conversation.

fields.name: discoveryId
fields.description: The Conversation's discoveryId. (formerly known as name)

fields.name: messages
fields.description: The Conversation's messages.

fields.name: latestMessage
fields.description: Latest message of a conversation

fields.name: discovery
fields.description: Discovery related to the conversation

fields.name: authorUserName
fields.description: Username of the person that started this conversation

fields.name: geohashPrefix
fields.description: geo has prefix - used as the primary partition key

fields.name: discoveryId
fields.description: id of the discovery, used as the primary sort key

fields.name: active
fields.description: Whether this discovery is on the network or not

fields.name: cognitoUserName
fields.description: Username of the owner, same thing as cognitoId

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the discovery

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price of the discovery

fields.name: request_or_offer
fields.description: Is this a request or an offer

fields.name: time
fields.description: When this discovery was created, seconds from epoch

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the discovery

fields.name: geoJson
fields.description: JSON Data that shows the positon of this discovery

fields.name: image_0
fields.description: image 1

fields.name: image_1
fields.description: image 2

fields.name: image_2
fields.description: image 3

fields.name: image_3
fields.description: image 4

fields.name: image_4
fields.description: image 5

fields.name: image_5
fields.description: image 5

fields.name: author
fields.description: Author of this discovery

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the discovery in degrees

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the discovery in degrees

fields.name: isSaved
fields.description: checks to see if this discovery has been added to my saved discoveries or not

fields.name: updateStripeAccount
fields.description:
Updates can only be done via passing a stripe account token.
 For more information, visit: https://stripe.com/docs/api#create_account_token

fields.name: createExternalAccount
fields.description: Creates an external account to attach to user's own stripe connected account.

fields.name: deleteExternalAccount
fields.description: Deletes external account that has been previously added to user's own connected account.

fields.name: updateExternalBankAccount
fields.description: Updates an external bank account information

fields.name: updateExternalDebitCard
fields.description: Updates an external debit card information

fields.name: createPaymentIntent
fields.description: Creates a payment intent object, with the tranfer destination set to another stripe customer's account

fields.name: cancelPaymentIntent
fields.description: Removes a payment intent object.

fields.name: createSetupIntent
fields.description:
Sends all the available funds in a user's account to a given external account
 payoutAvailableFunds(external_account: String!): AWSJSON
 Creates a setup intent

fields.name: updateSetupIntent
fields.description: updates a given setup Intent. Call this method when a user changes their payment method, or selects a new payment method type.

fields.name: confirmSetupIntent
fields.description: confirms a given setup Intent. Call this method when a user "saves" their payment method.

fields.name: cancelSetupIntent
fields.description: Cancels a setup intent, call this when user abandons the setup

fields.name: updateStripeCustomer
fields.description:
Customer
 For accounts that will be conducting payments

fields.name: attachPaymentMethod
fields.description:
Attaches a given payment method on to a customer. 
 The user making this request must also be a stripe customer.

fields.name: detachPaymentMethod
fields.description: Detaches a given payment method from a customer

fields.name: createConversation
fields.description:
SERVIN
 Create a Conversation. Use some of the cooked in template functions for UUID and DateTime.
 You can create a conversation based on the id. createdAt and id fields will be determined by us (So, users can't manipulate them)
 createConversation(createdAt: String, id: ID!, discoveryId: String!): Conversation

fields.name: createMessage
fields.description:
Create a message in a Conversation.
 We only let the users pass in content and the conversation id, we take care of created at and message id.
 createMessage(content: String, conversationId: ID!, createdAt: String!, id: ID!): Message

fields.name: createUserConversations
fields.description:
Put a single value of type 'User'. If an item does not exist with the same key the item will be created. If there exists an item at that key already, it will be updated.
 No need to create a new user
 createUser(username: String!): User
  Put a single value of type 'UserConversations'. If an item does not exist with the same key the item will be created. If there exists an item at that key already, it will be updated.

fields.name: updateProfileInformation
fields.description: Allows a user to edit their information

fields.name: updateCategories
fields.description: Allows a user to update their categories

fields.name: editDiscovery
fields.description: Allows a user to edit their own discovery, if trying to edit someone else's it throws an error.

fields.name: postDiscovery
fields.description: Allows a user to post a discovey

fields.name: updateProfilePicture
fields.description: Allows the user to update the path to their profile picture, stored in an S3 Bucket.

fields.name: saveDiscovery
fields.description: Saves a given discovery in the user's favourites

fields.name: removeSavedDiscovery
fields.description: removes a saved discovery

types.name: AWSEmail
types.description: The `AWSEmail` scalar type provided by AWS AppSync, represents an Email address string that complies with [RFC 822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc822.txt). For example, "**username@example.com**" is a valid Email address.

types.name: AWSPhone
types.description: The `AWSPhone` scalar type provided by AWS AppSync, represents a valid Phone Number. Phone numbers are serialized and deserialized as Strings. Segments of the phone number may be whitespace delimited or hyphenated.  The number can specify a country code at the beginning. However, numbers without country codes are still considered to be valid.

fields.name: subscribeToNewMessage
fields.description: Subscribes to all new messages in a given Conversation.

fields.name: subscribeToNewUCs
fields.description: Subscribe to a convo, if someone replies to your discovery

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema SDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar SDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface SDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum value SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field SDL definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

directives.name: defer
directives.description: This directive allows results to be deferred during execution

directives.name: aws_publish
directives.description: Tells the service which subscriptions will be published to when this mutation is called. This directive is deprecated use @aws_susbscribe directive instead.

args.name: subscriptions
args.description: List of subscriptions which will be published to when this mutation is called.

directives.name: aws_api_key
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by an API key.

directives.name: aws_auth
directives.description: Directs the schema to enforce authorization on a field

args.name: cognito_groups
args.description: List of cognito user pool groups which have access on this field

directives.name: aws_iam
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by sigv4 signing.

directives.name: aws_subscribe
directives.description: Tells the service which mutation triggers this subscription.

args.name: mutations
args.description: List of mutations which will trigger this subscription when they are called.

directives.name: aws_cognito_user_pools
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by a Cognito User Pools token.

args.name: cognito_groups
args.description: List of cognito user pool groups which have access on this field

directives.name: aws_oidc
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by an OIDC token.
